questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 29159

Answer the following question according to the paragraph.

Hi, I’m Jeremy. I went to Walt Disney World in Orlando, Florida with my family last summer. It was my favourite vacation. It was a long trip. Since my mother was afraid of flying, we travelled by my dad’s camper. There are four main parks at Walt Disney World: The Magic Kingdom, Epcot, Hollywood Studios, and Animal Kingdom. We went on attractions in these theme parks and I had lots of fun. We went on rides with my dad and siblings. We went on Splash Mountain and rode on logs. We went through a tunnel. At the end of the tunnel, everyone got wet. It was a breath-taking experience for me. At the theme parks, we saw different Disney characters. Dad took many photos of me with them. At Epcot Centre, we watched spectacular fireworks show and had fun. The shows were amazing and the land itself was so pretty. This was one of the most unforgettable vacation for all of us and we were contented with being there.

The fireworks display was ......  and the holiday was a breath-taking experience for me.

A) typical
B) ordinary
C) expected
D) wonderful
E) unremarkable
A B C D E
questionText: Answer the following question according to the paragraph. Hi, I’m Jeremy. I went to Walt Disney World in Orlando, Florida with my family last summer. It was my favourite vacation. It was a long trip. Since my mother was afraid of flying, we travelled by my dad’s camper. There are four main parks at Walt Disney World: The Magic Kingdom, Epcot, Hollywood Studios, and Animal Kingdom. We went on attractions in these theme parks and I had lots of fun. We went on rides with my dad and siblings. We went on Splash Mountain and rode on logs. We went through a tunnel. At the end of the tunnel, everyone got wet. It was a breath-taking experience for me. At the theme parks, we saw different Disney characters. Dad took many photos of me with them. At Epcot Centre, we watched spectacular fireworks show and had fun. The shows were amazing and the land itself was so pretty. This was one of the most unforgettable vacation for all of us and we were contented with being there. The fireworks display was ......  and the holiday was a breath-taking experience for me. A) typical B) ordinary C) expected D) wonderful E) unremarkable A B C D E

After World War II, he graduated with degrees in economics and law from the University of Sarajevo. He was an urbane and thoughtful politician who spoke English, French and German, in addition to Serbocroatian. He became the first President of the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina from 1990-1996 and member of the Presidency until his retirement in 2000. He died in 2003, and will be remembered for many years to come for his leadership of Bosnian Muslims in their heroic struggle to preserve their identity during the bloody war with Serbia. He was a wise king, a great leader, a hero of Bosnian Muslims and the symbol of resistance against oppression in the 20th century.

E) -

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15078

Why hobbies are important?

Having a hobby we enjoy not only brings us joy but also enriches our lives. It gives us something fun to do in our leisure time and affords us the opportunity to learn new skills which enhances our proficiency, productivity, perception and happiness in life. If you are in the edge of picking up a new hobby, it helps you to develop some skills and explore yourselves as unique individuals. A life without having a hobby may be dull and demanding so seasoning your life with something you like doing may be more than a good thing you suppose. At first, it makes you feel more energetic and motivated at work or in daily life. It also helps to relieve stress by keeping you engaged in something you enjoy.They let you relax and seek pleasure in activities that aren’t associated with work, chores or other responsibilities. Furthermore, it allows you make new friends on mutual interests and help you colour your social life. As a result, it boosts your confidence and self-esteem. All in all, when ‘’picking up the right hobby’’ just suits you and helps you to discover the ‘new you!’, it mentally and physiologically make you feel better, loaded with dopamine which inevitably foster your mood, attitude and self-esteem.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

All in all, when ‘’picking up the right hobby’’ just suits you and helps you to discover the ‘new you!’, it mentally and physiologically make you feel better, loaded with dopamine which inevitably foster your mood, attitude and self-esteem. A life without having a hobby may be dull and demanding so seasoning your life with something you like doing may be more than a good thing you suppose. At first, it makes you feel more energetic and motivated at work or in daily life. It also helps to relieve stress by keeping you engaged in something you enjoy.They let you relax and seek pleasure in activities that aren’t associated with work, chores or other responsibilities. Furthermore, it allows you make new friends on mutual interests and help you colour your social life. As a result, it boosts your confidence and self-esteem. All in all, when ‘’picking up the right hobby’’ just suits you and helps you to discover the ‘new you!’, it mentally and physiologically make you feel better, loaded with dopamine which inevitably foster your mood, attitude and self-esteem. questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15078

Why hobbies are important?

Having a hobby we enjoy not only brings us joy but also enriches our lives. It gives us something fun to do in our leisure time and affords us the opportunity to learn new skills which enhances our proficiency, productivity, perception and happiness in life. If you are in the edge of picking up a new hobby, it helps you to develop some skills and explore yourselves as unique individuals. A life without having a hobby may be dull and demanding so seasoning your life with something you like doing may be more than a good thing you suppose. At first, it makes you feel more energetic and motivated at work or in daily life. It also helps to relieve stress by keeping you engaged in something you enjoy.They let you relax and seek pleasure in activities that aren’t associated with work, chores or other responsibilities. Furthermore, it allows you make new friends on mutual interests and help you colour your social life. As a result, it boosts your confidence and self-esteem. All in all, when ‘’picking up the right hobby’’ just suits you and helps you to discover the ‘new you!’, it mentally and physiologically make you feel better, loaded with dopamine which inevitably foster your mood, attitude and self-esteem.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 53493

Read the text and answer the question.

The famous author, Stephen King, was broke and struggling when he first started writing. He received sixty rejections before selling his first short story, The Glass Floor, for $35. He was pursuing his goals while he was also working multiple jobs to support his family. In his journey, his wife supported him a lot. Whenever he became desperate or demotivated, she helped him stand up and persevere to go on writing. His iconic thriller book Carrie, which he submitted when he was twenty years old, was rejected by thirty publishers. Despite all the rejections and curveballs that life tossed at him, he never gave up and he could finally find an audience for his writings. Since then, he has published more than fifty books that all became worldwide bestsellers.

It is clear from the passage that …… .

A) Stephen King started writing when he started high school
B) He was having financial difficulties in the early years of his career
C) His wife supported the family financially while he was writing
D) His book, Carrie, became an iconic thriller as soon as he submitted it
E) He wouldn’t have achieved his goals if he had been rejected one more time
A B C D E

Read the following extracts from a diary which was written by a 21-year-old Turkish officer, Naci, who fought and died in the Gallipoli Campaign. Which of the statements below is wrong according to it?

‘‘I ate a loaf of bread with yoghurt, and drank tea. I slept for a while, and when I woke up, my adjutant delivered an order. He wanted soldiers to wash their feet and the injured ones should get their feet immersed in the salty water. There were over 30 soldiers with wounded feet. Some of them were really in bad condition. However, there was nothing that could be done.’

‘‘Meals were not brought tonight; soldiers were given cheese. ’’

‘‘The city was charming but gloomy when we arrived. There was nothing apart from the soldiers, cars and animals on the white and dusty streets of the city. Few shops, two restaurants, one or two coffee houses were open. All the remaining shops were closed. When the houses were occupied by the army, there were a few people who insisted on staying at their own places.’’

A) Wounded soldiers couldn’t get a proper medical care.
B) Food and subsistence of the soldiers were poor.
C) The city was almost deserted when the soldiers arrived.
D) There was noone left who stay in their houses.
E) Almost all the shops in the city were closed.
A B C D E

When J. K. Rawling first came up with a fully formed idea of Harry Potter in 1990, she immediately began writing furiously. Losing her mother at the same year, she moved to Portugal where she used to teach English. She got married there in 1992 but divorced the next year with a newborn daughter. She moved again, to Scotland this time to be closer to her sister with three chapters of Harry Potter already in her briefcase.

Young Rawling, with a dependant daughter considered herself as a failure at those times. She was a divorced, jobless and broke mother suffering through depression. Eventually, she signed up for social welfare. She was really in dire straits but she was able to overcome the difficulties of life.

B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15119

On Christmas Eve 1971, Juliane Koepcke was flying on LANSA Flight 508. The plane was struck by lightning and crashed. When Koepcke regained her conscious she found herself still strapped to her seat in the amazon rain forest.

She was the only survivor of the flight but injured very seriously with a broken collarbone. She was all alone in the wilderness. She had some candy in her pockets as her only food however she was able to find a small stream. She waded through the water and managed to keep herself hydrated at the same time.

Her bruises were pestered by the insects and maggots in the jungle and infected her arm.  After nine days, she was able to find an encampment. She tried basic first aid on herself. She even poured gasoline on the inflammation on her arm. After a few hours, some lumber workers found and helped her to get airlifted to a hospital.

In the documentary ‘Wings of Hope’ the director Werner Herzog, who cancelled his flight at the last minute on that very plane, told Koepcke’s story to the world for the first time in 2000.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E
questionText: On Christmas Eve 1971, Juliane Koepcke was flying on LANSA Flight 508. The plane was struck by lightning and crashed. When Koepcke regained her conscious she found herself still strapped to her seat in the amazon rain forest. She was the only survivor of the flight but injured very seriously with a broken collarbone. She was all alone in the wilderness. She had some candy in her pockets as her only food however she was able to find a small stream. She waded through the water and managed to keep herself hydrated at the same time. Her bruises were pestered by the insects and maggots in the jungle and infected her arm.  After nine days, she was able to find an encampment. She tried basic first aid on herself. She even poured gasoline on the inflammation on her arm. After a few hours, some lumber workers found and helped her to get airlifted to a hospital. In the documentary ‘Wings of Hope’ the director Werner Herzog, who cancelled his flight at the last minute on that very plane, told Koepcke’s story to the world for the first time in 2000. A) - B) - C) - D) - E) - A B C D E

questionAsHtml:

For 38 days, the Robertson Family was lost at the sea. A British dairy farmer, Dougal Robertson just wanted to take his family on a boat trip for the “university of life” as his son called it. On January 27, 1971, Dougal, his wife, and their four children set out on a wooden ship called the Lucette, heading to places unknown.
For 17 months at the sea, the family sailed from port to port, seeing the world. But on June 15, 1972, the family encountered a group of killer whales off the abandoned coasts of the Galapagos Islands.
The ship took in water when the whales attacked it. All they had was a lifeboat and six days worth of food. They survived on rainwater and hunted turtles. After 38 days adrift, the boat was no longer useable. It was a ten foot boat far over capacity but they managed to cling on until they were discovered by Japanese fishermen on July 23, 1972.

 

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 53503

Read the passage and answer the following question.

Marie Curie was a famous Polish scientist who was born in 1867 in Warsaw. Both her father and mother were teachers and they had six children. In the 19th century, typhus and tuberculosis used to be common diseases. When she was 7, her sister died of typhus. When she was 12, she lost her mother because of tuberculosis. Marie used to be a bright child and successful at school. In those times, women wouldn’t go to university. She had to go abroad and earn her living by herself there. She worked as a governess for a few years. Then, she began studying at the Sorbonne University and got a degree in Physics and Maths in four years’ time. She married to another scientist, Pierre Curie and they devoted their lives to science, investigating radioactive elements. In 1902, they found radium and were awarded the Nobel Prize for Physics. In the following years, Marie was also given the Nobel Prize for Chemistry. Due to being exposed to radiation so much, she had leukemia and died in 1934.

Which of the following is NOT about Marie Curie’s determination and success?

A) She used to be successful at school despite the tragedies she experienced.
B) She went abroad and worked as a governess to earn her living and study.
C) She gained degrees in both Physics and Maths in four years’ time.
D) She married to another great scientist, Pierre Currie and they had a daughter.
E) She devoted her life to science and had two Nobel Prizes.
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15171

PIRI REIS

Piri Reis is a well-known Ottoman-Turkish admiral, geographer and cartographer from the 16th century.  He is thought to have drawn the oldest world map in 1513 but the discovery of it took more than four centuries and present it to the today’s world. It was found during the restoration of Topkapı Palace and was thought that it belonged to Piri Reis thanks to his signature. The surviving and existing half of the map shows the western coasts of Europe and North Africa and the coast of Brazil with reasonable accuracy in addition to various Atlantic islands including the Azores and Canary Islands.

Piri Reis was born between 1465 and 1470 in Gallipoli on the Aegean coast of Turkey and by 1516;  He was a ship's captain  in the Ottoman fleet. He took part in the 1516-17 campaign against Egypt, and in 1517, he presented his map of the New World to Sultan Selim I and by this way provided the Ottomans with an accurate description of America as well as Africa. A year later, Salman Reis added to that. Then, Piri Reis composed the two versions of his book, Kitab-ı Bahriye in 1521 and 1525. After having completed his Kitab-i Bahriye in 1521, he participated in the following year to the siege of Rhodes, which ended with the island's surrender to the Ottomans in 1522. In 1524 he captained the ship that took the Ottoman Grand Vizier Makbul Ibrahim Pasha to Egypt. Following the Vizier's advice, he edited his book of navigation and was able to present it to Sultan Suleyman the Magnificent in 1525. Three years later he presented his second world map to the Sultan. By 1547, Piri Reis had risen to the rank of Reis (admiral) and was in command of the Ottoman fleet in the Indian Ocean and admiral of the fleet in Egypt. In 1548 he recaptured Aden from the Portuguese, followed in 1552 by the capture of Muscat, which Portugal had occupied since 1507. With so many important victories and discoveries, Piri Reis still remains as an important person for Turks after his death in 1550s.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

It was found during the restoration of Topkapı Palace and was thought that it belonged to Piri Reis thanks to his signature. The surviving and existing half of the map shows the western coasts of Europe and North Africa and the coast of Brazil with reasonable accuracy in addition to various Atlantic islands including the Azores and Canary Islands. Piri Reis was born between 1465 and 1470 in Gallipoli on the Aegean coast of Turkey and by 1516;  He was a ship's captain  in the Ottoman fleet. He took part in the 1516-17 campaign against Egypt, and in 1517, he presented his map of the New World to Sultan Selim I and by this way provided the Ottomans with an accurate description of America as well as Africa. A year later, Salman Reis added to that. Then, Piri Reis composed the two versions of his book, Kitab-ı Bahriye in 1521 and 1525. After having completed his Kitab-i Bahriye in 1521, he participated in the following year to the siege of Rhodes, which ended with the island's surrender to the Ottomans in 1522. In 1524 he captained the ship that took the Ottoman Grand Vizier Makbul Ibrahim Pasha to Egypt. Following the Vizier's advice, he edited his book of navigation and was able to present it to Sultan Suleyman the Magnificent in 1525. Three years later he presented his second world map to the Sultan. By 1547, Piri Reis had risen to the rank of Reis (admiral) and was in command of the Ottoman fleet in the Indian Ocean and admiral of the fleet in Egypt. In 1548 he recaptured Aden from the Portuguese, followed in 1552 by the capture of Muscat, which Portugal had occupied since 1507. With so many important victories and discoveries, Piri Reis still remains as an important person for Turks after his death in 1550s. A) - B) - C) - D) - E) - A B C D E

I. When he was 33, Van Gogh moved to Paris where he lived with his brother Theo. In Paris, Van Gogh befriended the Impressionists and lightened his colour palette. His later works changed into images of Paris, flowers, portraits, and self-portraits. 

II. While in the asylum he painted 150 paintings before he was released at the age of 37. The same year he shot himself in the chest while painting in a wheat field.  He died two days later with his brother at his side and was buried in France.

III. Two years later, Van Gogh moved from Paris to Arles dreaming of an artist community.  Artist Paul Gauguin joined him, but they could have never achieved the dream. When Gauguin left him, Van Gogh cut off his ear due to frustration. Struggling with mental issues, he stayed in an asylum in Saint Remy.

IV. Vincent Van Gogh was born in Holland in 1853 and became one of the most well-known and influential artists of the 19th century. He tried several jobs including a preacher before deciding to become an artist at the age of twenty-seven. He painted dark portrays of peasants at work.

A) IV - I - III - II
B) III - I - II - IV
C) II - III - I - IV
D) IV - III - I - II
E) I - II - III - IV
A B C D E

IV- Haluk Bilginer, a Turkish actor, was born in 1954 in İzmir. V- After graduating from the Theatre Department at Ankara State Conservatory, Bilginer started to work for the State Theatres. A) I - II - V - III - IV B) V- IV - III - II - I C) II - V - I - IV - III D) IV - I - V - II - III E) III - I - II - V - IV A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15171

PIRI REIS

Piri Reis is a well-known Ottoman-Turkish admiral, geographer and cartographer from the 16th century.  He is thought to have drawn the oldest world map in 1513 but the discovery of it took more than four centuries and present it to the today’s world. It was found during the restoration of Topkapı Palace and was thought that it belonged to Piri Reis thanks to his signature. The surviving and existing half of the map shows the western coasts of Europe and North Africa and the coast of Brazil with reasonable accuracy in addition to various Atlantic islands including the Azores and Canary Islands.

Piri Reis was born between 1465 and 1470 in Gallipoli on the Aegean coast of Turkey and by 1516;  He was a ship's captain  in the Ottoman fleet. He took part in the 1516-17 campaign against Egypt, and in 1517, he presented his map of the New World to Sultan Selim I and by this way provided the Ottomans with an accurate description of America as well as Africa. A year later, Salman Reis added to that. Then, Piri Reis composed the two versions of his book, Kitab-ı Bahriye in 1521 and 1525. After having completed his Kitab-i Bahriye in 1521, he participated in the following year to the siege of Rhodes, which ended with the island's surrender to the Ottomans in 1522. In 1524 he captained the ship that took the Ottoman Grand Vizier Makbul Ibrahim Pasha to Egypt. Following the Vizier's advice, he edited his book of navigation and was able to present it to Sultan Suleyman the Magnificent in 1525. Three years later he presented his second world map to the Sultan. By 1547, Piri Reis had risen to the rank of Reis (admiral) and was in command of the Ottoman fleet in the Indian Ocean and admiral of the fleet in Egypt. In 1548 he recaptured Aden from the Portuguese, followed in 1552 by the capture of Muscat, which Portugal had occupied since 1507. With so many important victories and discoveries, Piri Reis still remains as an important person for Turks after his death in 1550s.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E
questionText: PIRI REIS Piri Reis is a well-known Ottoman-Turkish admiral, geographer and cartographer from the 16th century.  He is thought to have drawn the oldest world map in 1513 but the discovery of it took more than four centuries and present it to the today’s world. It was found during the restoration of Topkapı Palace and was thought that it belonged to Piri Reis thanks to his signature. The surviving and existing half of the map shows the western coasts of Europe and North Africa and the coast of Brazil with reasonable accuracy in addition to various Atlantic islands including the Azores and Canary Islands. Piri Reis was born between 1465 and 1470 in Gallipoli on the Aegean coast of Turkey and by 1516;  He was a ship's captain  in the Ottoman fleet. He took part in the 1516-17 campaign against Egypt, and in 1517, he presented his map of the New World to Sultan Selim I and by this way provided the Ottomans with an accurate description of America as well as Africa. A year later, Salman Reis added to that. Then, Piri Reis composed the two versions of his book, Kitab-ı Bahriye in 1521 and 1525. After having completed his Kitab-i Bahriye in 1521, he participated in the following year to the siege of Rhodes, which ended with the island's surrender to the Ottomans in 1522. In 1524 he captained the ship that took the Ottoman Grand Vizier Makbul Ibrahim Pasha to Egypt. Following the Vizier's advice, he edited his book of navigation and was able to present it to Sultan Suleyman the Magnificent in 1525. Three years later he presented his second world map to the Sultan. By 1547, Piri Reis had risen to the rank of Reis (admiral) and was in command of the Ottoman fleet in the Indian Ocean and admiral of the fleet in Egypt. In 1548 he recaptured Aden from the Portuguese, followed in 1552 by the capture of Muscat, which Portugal had occupied since 1507. With so many important victories and discoveries, Piri Reis still remains as an important person for Turks after his death in 1550s. A) - B) - C) - D) - E) - A B C D E

Hi, I’m Jeremy. I went to Walt Disney World in Orlando, Florida with my family last summer. It was my favourite vacation. It was a long trip. Since my mother was afraid of flying, we travelled by my dad’s camper. There are four main parks at Walt Disney World: The Magic Kingdom, Epcot, Hollywood Studios, and Animal Kingdom. We went on attractions in these theme parks and I had lots of fun. We went on rides with my dad and siblings. We went on Splash Mountain and rode on logs. We went through a tunnel. At the end of the tunnel, everyone got wet. It was a breath-taking experience for me. At the theme parks, we saw different Disney characters. Dad took many photos of me with them. At Epcot Centre, we watched spectacular fireworks show and had fun. The shows were amazing and the land itself was so pretty. This was one of the most unforgettable vacation for all of us and we were contented with being there.

As Jeremy’s mom was afraid of planes, ...... .

A) they had to go by plane
B) it was Jeremy’s favourite vacation
C) they preferred going there by a camper
D) they decided to stay in a hostel one night
E) they went through many tunnels on the way
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15228

                                                    UNSOLVED MYSTERY

This is the mysterious but true story of the ghost ship Mary Celeste which has fascinated us for more than hundred years. Nobody really knows what happened to the crew of the ship. The bizarre story began when the people saw a small sailing ship entered the bay of Gibraltar.

Mary Celeste departed from New York City on November 7, 1872. She was carrying a cargo of industrial alcohol. Benjamin Briggs who was the captain of the ship was a highly respected man. He was very experienced in his career and had spent most of his life on the sea. His wife Sarah and his daughter Sophie were on the ship, too. There were also seven crew members, making a total of ten.

A week later, another British vessel the Dei Gratia left New York for Italy. The captain of the ship David Morehouse spotted the Mary Celeste off the coast of Portugal. He tried to make contact but there was no reply. So the captain decided to send some of his sailors to the ship to have a look. The vessel was in a seaworthy condition but it seemed that all the passengers and crew vanished without a trace. Its stores and personal belongings were untouched but some special equipment and all the ship’s papers were missing, except the captain’s logbook. There was a lot of water between the decks and everything, including the captain’s bed. Also the galley was in a bad state and the cooking pots were everywhere. It looked like they left in a hurry. They even didn’t take their boots perhaps they might have thought the ship was going to sink. But the question was how they left the ship. There were no dinghies on board and ropes were found hanging over the side.

In addition, the cargo was untouched but later it was discovered that nine of the barrels were found empty. Leaking alcohol might have caused fumes and they might have worried that there could be an explosion.

However, why the crew and the passengers left the ship and what had happened to them will always remain as an unsolved mystery.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

He was very experienced in his career and had spent most of his life on the sea. His wife Sarah and his daughter Sophie were on the ship, too. There were also seven crew members, making a total of ten. A week later, another British vessel the Dei Gratia left New York for Italy. The captain of the ship David Morehouse spotted the Mary Celeste off the coast of Portugal. He tried to make contact but there was no reply. So the captain decided to send some of his sailors to the ship to have a look. The vessel was in a seaworthy condition but it seemed that all the passengers and crew vanished without a trace. Its stores and personal belongings were untouched but some special equipment and all the ship’s papers were missing, except the captain’s logbook. There was a lot of water between the decks and everything, including the captain’s bed. Also the galley was in a bad state and the cooking pots were everywhere. It looked like they left in a hurry. They even didn’t take their boots perhaps they might have thought the ship was going to sink. But the question was how they left the ship. There were no dinghies on board and ropes were found hanging over the side. In addition, the cargo was untouched but later it was discovered that nine of the barrels were found empty. Leaking alcohol might have caused fumes and they might have worried that there could be an explosion. However, why the crew and the passengers left the ship and what had happened to them will always remain as an unsolved mystery. A) - B) - C) - D) - E) - A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15215

A philosophy professor stood before his class with some items on the table in front of him. When the class began, wordlessly he picked up a very large and empty mayonnaise jar and proceeded to fill it with rocks, about inches in diameter. He then asked the students if the jar was full. They agreed that it was. So the professor then picked up a box of pebbles and poured them into the jar. He shook the jar lightly. The pebbles, of course, rolled into the open areas between the rocks. He then asked the students again if the jar was full. They agreed it was. The professor picked up a box of sand and poured it into the jar. Of course, the sand filled up the remaining open areas of the jar. He then asked once more if the jar was full. The students responded with a unanimous “Yes.” “Now,” said the professor, “I want you to recognize that this jar represents your life. The rocks are the important things – your family, your partner, your health, and your children – things that if everything else was lost and only they remained, your life would still be full. The pebbles are the other things that matter – like your job, your house, your car. The sand is everything else, the small stuff in your life.” Then, the professor gave the jar to one of his students and asked her to fill the jar by herself. She first put the sand, then pebbles, and finally the rocks. The professor watched the girl silently and with a cute smile on his face while she was filling the jar. Then he asked if she has finished and added, “you shouldn’t have put the sand first” and he turned to the class; “If you put the sand into the jar first,” he continued, “there is no room for the pebbles or the rocks. The same goes for your life. If you spend all your time and energy on the small stuff, you will never have room for the things that are important to you. Pay attention to the things that are critical to your happiness. Play with your children. Take your partner out dancing. There will always be time to go to work, clean the house, give a dinner party, or fix the disposal.” “Take care of the rocks first – the things that really matter. Set your priorities. The rest is just sand.”

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15223

Tom made some mistakes that could have had really serious consequences. He was on beach holiday and enjoyed himself diving and water-skiing. As the days passed, he felt a bit bored and decided to explore the mountain to go trekking.

 Late in the afternoon, without any equipment, even forgetting to change his sandals, he set off up the mountain. On the halfway, he was amazed by the beautiful scenery and wanted to take a photo. That moment he realized that he had forgotten to take his mobile phone. But it was almost getting dark and too late to go back. So he sat on a huge grey rock and started to watch the sunset. The weather was so cool and the nature was so silent that he unconsciously fell asleep. When he woke up it was completely dark. He was a bit scared because he hadn’t told anyone where he was going. He leapt up and started to run in panic. He was moving so fast that he stumbled and fell down. His ankle was aching so badly. He thought that he might have injured it. He tried to walk but he couldn’t. It was inevitable that he would spent the night there.

 Early in the morning Tom woke up with a noise. It was the voice of the search and rescue team. Tom was lucky that they found and brought him to the hospital. On the way he was thinking about the silly mistakes he had done. He felt regret for an instant. If he hadn’t forgotten his mobile phone, he would have asked for help immediately. And if he had gone trekking earlier, it wouldn’t have got dark. Moreover if he hadn’t forgotten to change his sandals, he wouldn’t have fallen. But he realized the most important thing that all these mistakes taught him a lesson. He couldn’t change the past but he could learn from his mistakes. He was lucky, worse could have happened.   

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15258

Hannah, 28 years old.

She has unquenchable lust for travelling. Since, she has visited nearly all popular tourist destinations, she loves flying to unfamiliar places to have funny experiences. She flies long distances so many times that she always keeps her day cream in her bag to avoid dry skin in airplanes. Although she hasn’t got a permanent job, her vacation expenses have always been supported by her wealthy father. She has a sole aim in her life and it is having fun! She likes bragging about her travelling memories. Her motto is: Loving life is easier when you’re abroad.

Yusuf, 36 years old.

He is craving new experiences. Seeing the world by learning is above everything for him. He thinks that travelling opens his mind and helps him to realize there is no one-way to live. He thinks setting away from home gives him the opportunity to reflect on his life. It is a chance to let his mind wander and take stock. He aims at having connection with the places he has visited. He creates opportunities for travelling when he feels like he has stuck in a routine in his daily life. As a full time traveller, he has always lived out of a bag pack and always been obsessed with his country’s unique beauty as a good observer.

THE EDESSAN BEAUTY

When you think about travelling, the first place that comes to your mind is abroad. However, before travelling through your own country, overseas have nothing to give you. Edessa, or the modern-day saying Şanlıurfa is a marvellous and a holly city in east where the Prophet Abraham was born. If you want to dive into Turkey’s rich culture and heritage, Şanlıurfa is a great route to discover.

see/do/eat

 visit Göbeklitepe : when excavations began here in mid 1990’s, archaeologists  discovered the world’s oldest  religious temple site. This is a must-see.

sip your tea on foothill of ‘’ Şanlıurfa Castle’’

eat ‘’kebap’’ and grilled meat sold by kebap vendors, sit on a wooden stool and enjoy your meal.

purchase a kilo of ‘’baklava’’ and pistachio as a rememberance, which is priceless.

CHARMING MALLORCA

As a beach holiday and resort destination, Mallorca is a gorgeous Mediterranean island with beautiful weather, stunning scenery and delicious cuisine. Along the picturesque coastline, dramatic cliffs offer sensational viewpoints and crystal-clear water. Vacationers are also delighted by the lovable villages, which are loaded with touristic attractions at night and noon.

see/do/eat

watch the sunset after swimming all day;

Mallorca has breath-taking sunset to see which should be in your bucket list.

eat lunch in Santanyi and discover all kinds of tasty tapas.

attend the festival Sant Bartomeu;

In August, do as the locals do, wet your clothes in the fountain and let the fireworks shower down on you.

If you can afford, buy Mallorca pearls and keep it forever as a reminder of your unforgettable, luxurious holiday.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15258

Hannah, 28 years old.

She has unquenchable lust for travelling. Since, she has visited nearly all popular tourist destinations, she loves flying to unfamiliar places to have funny experiences. She flies long distances so many times that she always keeps her day cream in her bag to avoid dry skin in airplanes. Although she hasn’t got a permanent job, her vacation expenses have always been supported by her wealthy father. She has a sole aim in her life and it is having fun! She likes bragging about her travelling memories. Her motto is: Loving life is easier when you’re abroad.

Yusuf, 36 years old.

He is craving new experiences. Seeing the world by learning is above everything for him. He thinks that travelling opens his mind and helps him to realize there is no one-way to live. He thinks setting away from home gives him the opportunity to reflect on his life. It is a chance to let his mind wander and take stock. He aims at having connection with the places he has visited. He creates opportunities for travelling when he feels like he has stuck in a routine in his daily life. As a full time traveller, he has always lived out of a bag pack and always been obsessed with his country’s unique beauty as a good observer.

THE EDESSAN BEAUTY

When you think about travelling, the first place that comes to your mind is abroad. However, before travelling through your own country, overseas have nothing to give you. Edessa, or the modern-day saying Şanlıurfa is a marvellous and a holly city in east where the Prophet Abraham was born. If you want to dive into Turkey’s rich culture and heritage, Şanlıurfa is a great route to discover.

see/do/eat

 visit Göbeklitepe : when excavations began here in mid 1990’s, archaeologists  discovered the world’s oldest  religious temple site. This is a must-see.

sip your tea on foothill of ‘’ Şanlıurfa Castle’’

eat ‘’kebap’’ and grilled meat sold by kebap vendors, sit on a wooden stool and enjoy your meal.

purchase a kilo of ‘’baklava’’ and pistachio as a rememberance, which is priceless.

CHARMING MALLORCA

As a beach holiday and resort destination, Mallorca is a gorgeous Mediterranean island with beautiful weather, stunning scenery and delicious cuisine. Along the picturesque coastline, dramatic cliffs offer sensational viewpoints and crystal-clear water. Vacationers are also delighted by the lovable villages, which are loaded with touristic attractions at night and noon.

see/do/eat

watch the sunset after swimming all day;

Mallorca has breath-taking sunset to see which should be in your bucket list.

eat lunch in Santanyi and discover all kinds of tasty tapas.

attend the festival Sant Bartomeu;

In August, do as the locals do, wet your clothes in the fountain and let the fireworks shower down on you.

If you can afford, buy Mallorca pearls and keep it forever as a reminder of your unforgettable, luxurious holiday.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15280

ZERO POINT IN HISTORY: GOBEKLITEPE

Göbeklitepe is an archaeological site near Şanlıurfa in southeast of Turkey. It is known to be the world’s first temple. It was built roughly twelve thousand years ago, around 10,000 BC. That means it is very much older than Stonehenge, the famous prehistoric monument in England.

In the site, there are dozens of huge stone pillars. The stones are arranged to make circles with two monumental pillars in the centre. All pillars are T-shaped and 3-6 metres tall. Archaeologists think that those T-shapes symbolise human beings. Some of the megaliths are blank but some have figures on them. On the flat surface of these mystical rock statues, there are abstract symbols and carvings of animals such as foxes, snakes, scorpions, wild ducks and boars. We also come across some three-dimensional figures of lions.

When the site was first investigated in 1960s, archaeologists thought that it was a medieval cemetery and didn’t pay much attention. Then, it was explored again in 1990s by German archaeologist and pre-historian Klaus Schmidt and its true age was revealed by carbon-dating. Thousands of wild animal bones have been uncovered there, but not any trash pits, fireplaces or any other signs of domestic life. That is why most experts identify the place as a religious ritual site. They think it attracted worshippers even from great distances.

At the time of Göbeklitepe's construction, the human race lived in small nomadic groups, eating plants and hunting wild animals. It is amazing how the temple's builders were able to cut, shape, and transport hundreds of huge stones without having wheels or beasts of burden. Even with today’s technology people would need specialized equipment to move those stones.

Anyway, archaeologists are still excavating Göbeklitepe and debating over its meaning. Further research may change our understanding of the birth of civilisation. Only time will tell.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

In 1582, Pope Gregory XIII adjusted the calendar. He changed the date March 25th which was traditionally celebrated as the New Year's Day. Since then, January 1st has been adopted to be the New Year's Day worldwide. But in China, New Year is based on the lunar calendar so the date actually changes from year to year between January and February 21st depending on when the new moon of the first lunar month falls. On the other hand, Ethiopian New Year, also called Enkutatash, meaning the 'gift of jewels' is celebrated on September 11th, at the end of the big rains.

B) is still celebrated as the new year 
C) was Pope Gregory XIII's birthday 
D) is an important day for Chinese culture 
E) is accepted to be the beginning of lunar calendar
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15258

Hannah, 28 years old.

She has unquenchable lust for travelling. Since, she has visited nearly all popular tourist destinations, she loves flying to unfamiliar places to have funny experiences. She flies long distances so many times that she always keeps her day cream in her bag to avoid dry skin in airplanes. Although she hasn’t got a permanent job, her vacation expenses have always been supported by her wealthy father. She has a sole aim in her life and it is having fun! She likes bragging about her travelling memories. Her motto is: Loving life is easier when you’re abroad.

Yusuf, 36 years old.

He is craving new experiences. Seeing the world by learning is above everything for him. He thinks that travelling opens his mind and helps him to realize there is no one-way to live. He thinks setting away from home gives him the opportunity to reflect on his life. It is a chance to let his mind wander and take stock. He aims at having connection with the places he has visited. He creates opportunities for travelling when he feels like he has stuck in a routine in his daily life. As a full time traveller, he has always lived out of a bag pack and always been obsessed with his country’s unique beauty as a good observer.

THE EDESSAN BEAUTY

When you think about travelling, the first place that comes to your mind is abroad. However, before travelling through your own country, overseas have nothing to give you. Edessa, or the modern-day saying Şanlıurfa is a marvellous and a holly city in east where the Prophet Abraham was born. If you want to dive into Turkey’s rich culture and heritage, Şanlıurfa is a great route to discover.

see/do/eat

 visit Göbeklitepe : when excavations began here in mid 1990’s, archaeologists  discovered the world’s oldest  religious temple site. This is a must-see.

sip your tea on foothill of ‘’ Şanlıurfa Castle’’

eat ‘’kebap’’ and grilled meat sold by kebap vendors, sit on a wooden stool and enjoy your meal.

purchase a kilo of ‘’baklava’’ and pistachio as a rememberance, which is priceless.

CHARMING MALLORCA

As a beach holiday and resort destination, Mallorca is a gorgeous Mediterranean island with beautiful weather, stunning scenery and delicious cuisine. Along the picturesque coastline, dramatic cliffs offer sensational viewpoints and crystal-clear water. Vacationers are also delighted by the lovable villages, which are loaded with touristic attractions at night and noon.

see/do/eat

watch the sunset after swimming all day;

Mallorca has breath-taking sunset to see which should be in your bucket list.

eat lunch in Santanyi and discover all kinds of tasty tapas.

attend the festival Sant Bartomeu;

In August, do as the locals do, wet your clothes in the fountain and let the fireworks shower down on you.

If you can afford, buy Mallorca pearls and keep it forever as a reminder of your unforgettable, luxurious holiday.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15308

Fifty volunteers were alphabetically divided into two equal groups, Group A to participate in a 7 week exercise programme, and Group B to avoid deliberate exercise of any sort during those 7 weeks. On the day before the exercise programme began, all 50 subjects participated in a step-test. This consisted of stepping up and down on a 16 inch bench at 30 steps a minute for 5 minutes. One minute after completion of the step-test, the pulse rate of each subject was taken and recorded. This served as the pre-test for the experiment. For the next 7 weeks, subjects in the experimental group (Group A) rode an execycle (a motor-driven bicycle-type exercise machine) for 15 minutes each day. The exercise schedule called for riders to ride relaxed during the first day’s ride, merely holding on to the handle bars and foot pedals as the machine moved. Then, for the next 3 days, they rode relaxed for 50 seconds of each minute, and pushed, pulled, and pedalled actively for 10 seconds of each minute. The ratio of active riding was increased every few days, so that by the third week it was half of each minute, and by the seventh week the riders were performing 15 solid minutes of active riding.

At the end of the 7 weeks, the step-test was again given to both groups of subjects, and their pulses were taken. The post-exercise pulse rates of subjects in the experimental group were found to have decreased an average of 30 heart beats per minute, with the lowest decrease 28 and the highest decrease 46. The pulse rates of subjects in the control group remained the same or changed no more than 4 beats, with an average difference between the initial and final tests.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15302

TRAVIS PASTRANA UNVEILED

Travis Patrana turned 34 on Monday. While that makes him a longtime vet of the action sports world, it's surprising that he's still so young. This is because he's been winning X Games gold medals since 1999 when he was just 15 years old. Last month, Pastrana sat down with a Turkish magazine for a wide-ranging interview that touched on everything from how he got his start to how starting a family has changed his outlook on what he does for a living.

But for those interested in the full interview, we've decided to publish the full transcript:

Interviewer: How did you first get into extreme sports, specifically motocross?

TRAVIS: “I think I got into it more because all my uncles rode motorcycles pretty much everyday after work. My parents both raced motorcycles. So they inspired me. When I was four, I got my first bike. When we went on camping trips, we took motorcycles with us.”

Your family is full of more traditional athletes, what was their reaction when you wanted to make a career out of this?

“My dad always said they would do their best to support me. He always used that as a tool to help me do anything else.”

Tell us about your going from motocross to rally to NASCAR to monster trucks…

“When I got into X Games, I was only 15, and couldn’t turn pro in motocross. And that turned into something, but I kept getting hurt. And whenever I got hurt, I drove cars or go-carts or whatever. A broken wrist meant you couldn’t ride but you could drive. So I started driving a lot, and then had the chance with some of my sponsors from motocross, and they took me over to Europe to drive a world rally car. Afterwards, I always loved monster trucks growing up — I was able to jump into that just, I mean, kind of just for fun. And then NASCAR. It’s the top form of racing in the U.S.”

What’s your favorite thing to drive?

“Every experiences is different and that is awesome. Just to jump in a monster truck. Two thousand horse power. You can jump them — never had whiplash so bad in my life — but just in the air, you’re like strapped in a cage. You got a rally car, that’s zero to 60 in 1.8 seconds, so it feels like a dragster. You can do anything with it. And then NASCAR. They have a lot of horsepower, but no handling capabilities, and they're super fast. So it’s probably the hardest thing I’ve ever drove. And it’s silly, because it looks like they’re just driving around in circles.

After a wreck, did you ever think about switching careers?

The 2003 car crash in which the passenger was severely injured was the only incident that made me think so.

Interviewer: Tell us one question that you’re tired of getting asked.

TRAVIS: “Two questions. No. 1 — How many bones have you broken? No. 2 — Does it hurt when you crash?”

Outside of the action sports, what’s your favorite sport to watch or play?

“I am fond of modern kind sports, mostly lacrosse, xpogo, blobbing and zorbing.

GLOSSARY:

Lacrosse: a team sport played with a stick and a ball.

Blobbing: A giant airbag set in the middle of lake and a person on one end and another jumps onto the other.

Zorbing: In a giant inflattable ball, a person jumps inside and rolls down a hill.

Xpogo: On a pogo stick you get on and jump up to 5 meters.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:

     Answer the following question according to the paragraph.

      The Women’s National Basketball Association (WNBA) was established in 1996 but hasn’t come close to matching the popularity of the NBA yet.

      Women began playing basketball in 1892, but they were expected to compete while dressed in floor-length dresses and petticoats. Stanford college banned women’s basketball in 1899 “for the good of the students’ health” and for “the unpleasant publicity accompanying the contests.” Women’s basketball was not regularly played at U.S. high schools and colleges until after the 1972 Title IX law was signed by President Richard Nixon. The law prevents schools from discriminating on the basis of sex and led to the creation of women’s sports teams (including basketball) in colleges and high schools throughout the United States. The game that began with two peach baskets and a soccer ball in a gymnasium in Massachusetts has certainly made its mark on the world.  

Which information is not stated in the passage?

A) After the law was signed in the U.S, women started to play at high schools.
B) The women players had restrictions when they started to compete.
C) Most of the schools used to prevent girls playing in the basketball league.
D) The law signed by Nixon stopped sex discrimination at schools in the US.
E) The women’s basketball association isn’t as popular as NBA league.
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15316

Answer the following question according to the paragraph.

The head of the physical education department at the International YMCA Training School (now called Springfield College) in Massachusetts, issued a challenge to his graduate students in 1891. He asked them to create a fast-paced, easy-to-learn game that could be played in the gymnasium during the winter months. The game was created by 31-year-old Canadian James Naismith required two teams of nine players to face off against one another. To score points for their team, a player had to land a soccer ball into a cardboard box. After the school’s janitor was unable to find cardboard boxes, Naismith used wooden peach baskets and mounted them at each end of the gymnasium. He called his new game basketball, and wooden baskets were used until 1903 when a Rhode Island company developed an iron hoop with an attached net.

Who was the game of basketball created by?

A) school’s janitor
B) James Naismith
C) graduate students
D) Rhode company
E) two teams
A B C D E

After an 1892 article about basketball appeared in a magazine, the new sport spread like wildfire throughout the United States. Teams from 23 countries competed in games played in an outdoor tennis stadium, and the United States played in the rain to win the gold medal. Despite the game’s ongoing popularity in the United States, low fan attendance plagued professional men’s basketball for most of its history. For that reason, Naismith’s original rules were modified on numerous occasions to make the game more exciting and appealing to fans. Even after two leagues merged to form the 17-team National Basketball Association (NBA) in 1949, the future of the sport was questionable. C) The sport spread its popularity when the NBA merged.
D) When games started to be broadcasted on TV, its popularity increased.
E) After an article in a magazine, the game became very popular.
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15302

TRAVIS PASTRANA UNVEILED

Travis Patrana turned 34 on Monday. While that makes him a longtime vet of the action sports world, it's surprising that he's still so young. This is because he's been winning X Games gold medals since 1999 when he was just 15 years old. Last month, Pastrana sat down with a Turkish magazine for a wide-ranging interview that touched on everything from how he got his start to how starting a family has changed his outlook on what he does for a living.

But for those interested in the full interview, we've decided to publish the full transcript:

Interviewer: How did you first get into extreme sports, specifically motocross?

TRAVIS: “I think I got into it more because all my uncles rode motorcycles pretty much everyday after work. My parents both raced motorcycles. So they inspired me. When I was four, I got my first bike. When we went on camping trips, we took motorcycles with us.”

Your family is full of more traditional athletes, what was their reaction when you wanted to make a career out of this?

“My dad always said they would do their best to support me. He always used that as a tool to help me do anything else.”

Tell us about your going from motocross to rally to NASCAR to monster trucks…

“When I got into X Games, I was only 15, and couldn’t turn pro in motocross. And that turned into something, but I kept getting hurt. And whenever I got hurt, I drove cars or go-carts or whatever. A broken wrist meant you couldn’t ride but you could drive. So I started driving a lot, and then had the chance with some of my sponsors from motocross, and they took me over to Europe to drive a world rally car. Afterwards, I always loved monster trucks growing up — I was able to jump into that just, I mean, kind of just for fun. And then NASCAR. It’s the top form of racing in the U.S.”

What’s your favorite thing to drive?

“Every experiences is different and that is awesome. Just to jump in a monster truck. Two thousand horse power. You can jump them — never had whiplash so bad in my life — but just in the air, you’re like strapped in a cage. You got a rally car, that’s zero to 60 in 1.8 seconds, so it feels like a dragster. You can do anything with it. And then NASCAR. They have a lot of horsepower, but no handling capabilities, and they're super fast. So it’s probably the hardest thing I’ve ever drove. And it’s silly, because it looks like they’re just driving around in circles.

After a wreck, did you ever think about switching careers?

The 2003 car crash in which the passenger was severely injured was the only incident that made me think so.

Interviewer: Tell us one question that you’re tired of getting asked.

TRAVIS: “Two questions. No. 1 — How many bones have you broken? No. 2 — Does it hurt when you crash?”

Outside of the action sports, what’s your favorite sport to watch or play?

“I am fond of modern kind sports, mostly lacrosse, xpogo, blobbing and zorbing.

GLOSSARY:

Lacrosse: a team sport played with a stick and a ball.

Blobbing: A giant airbag set in the middle of lake and a person on one end and another jumps onto the other.

Zorbing: In a giant inflattable ball, a person jumps inside and rolls down a hill.

Xpogo: On a pogo stick you get on and jump up to 5 meters.

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

It identifies a trend among young people who use mobile phones for many activities, such as texting, e-mail, entertainment, and conversations, as opposed to using keyboards with traditional desktop computers. Without any hesitation, they always send e-mails to their friends from their mobile phones using only one hand.

The reason why it is called 'Thumb Generation' is that ...... .

A) because it is a trend among young people
B) they have grown up in a world that is absolutely different from the one we lived in
C) thumb generation's communication way depends on using thumbs for texting messages
D) because thumb's communication way depends on writing e-mails on the Net
E) thumb's communication way depends on talking face to face
A B C D E

proficient with MS Office programmes.

excellent communication skills (interpersonal, caring, sincere concern for customers)

creative problem solving skills (quick thinking, practicality, decision making skills)

stress management, time management, multi tasking, organization

About Us

DZ Pizza, which has more than 1500 stores around the world, began in 1960 as a single store in Quebec, Canada. Now, it has been reshaped, renewed and reenergized with innovations. In the rise of becoming a true technology leader, the brand is now consistently one of the top 5 companies in online transaction and 50% of our sales in the USA are taken through digital channels. If this sounds like a brand you’d like to be a part of, consider joining our team.

Additional Job Details

In this position the ‘’Customer Care Representative’‘ will monitor responsibilities listed as follows:

Social media costumer concerns

Coordinating with internal departments and marketplaces

Documenting cases into database as needed

Following up with the customers franchisee and/or marketplace

The ideal candidate will participate in the development and implementation of policies and procedures relative to all customer contacts. Assist in new team member training as needed.

Qualifications & Requirements

Bachelor Degree in Customer Affairs or Marketing (preferably M.B.A. or M.A in PR)

min. 2 years Social Media Communication experience

min. 2 years experience in relational databases, such as MicroSoft Access.

proficient with MS Office programmes.

excellent communication skills (interpersonal, caring, sincere concern for customers)

creative problem solving skills (quick thinking, practicality, decision making skills)

stress management, time management, multi tasking, organization

If you want to be a member of our team e- mail us your cover letter and complete resume with a recent photograph by 25 April, 2018.      info@dzpizzaa.com

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

In 1582, Pope Gregory XIII adjusted the calendar. He changed the date March 25th which was traditionally celebrated as the New Year's Day. Since then, January 1st has been adopted to be the New Year's Day worldwide. But in China, New Year is based on the lunar calendar so the date actually changes from year to year between January and February 21st depending on when the new moon of the first lunar month falls. On the other hand, Ethiopian New Year, also called Enkutatash, meaning the 'gift of jewels' is celebrated on September 11th, at the end of the big rains.

According to the text, the new year celebrations ...... .

A) take place at the same time all over the world 
B) haven't changed much throughout the history 
C) vary from culture to culture 
D) have nothing in common among the cultures 
E) were invented by Pope Gregory XIII
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15388

A Glass of Milk, Paid in Full
One day, a poor boy who was selling goods from door to door to pay his way through school, found he had only one thin dime left, and he was hungry. He decided he would ask for a meal at the next house. However, he lost his nerve when a lovely young woman opened the door.
Instead of a meal he asked for a drink of water. She thought he looked hungry so brought him a large glass of milk. He drank it slowly, and then asked, “How much do I owe you?” 
“You don’t owe me anything,” she replied. “Mother has taught us never to accept pay for a kindness.” He said, “Then I thank you from my heart.” As Howard Kelly left that house, he not only felt stronger physically, but his faith in God and man was strong also. He had been ready to give up and quit. 
Years later that young woman became critically ill. The local doctors were baffled. They finally sent her to the big city, where they called in specialists to study her rare disease. Dr. Howard Kelly was called in for the consultation. When he heard the name of the town she came from, a strange light filled his eyes. Immediately he rose and went down the hall of the hospital to her room. Dressed in his doctor’s gown he went into see her. He recognized her at once. He went back to the consultation room determined to do his best to save her life. From that day, he gave special attention to the complicated case. After a long struggle, the battle was won. Dr. Kelly requested the business office to pass the final bill to him for approval. He looked at it, then wrote something on the edge and the bill was sent to her room. She feared to open it, for she was sure it would take the rest of her life to pay for it all. Finally she looked, and something caught her attention on the side of the bill. She began to read the following words:
“Paid in full with one glass of milk.
Signed, Dr. Howard Kelly.”

 

A) -
B) -
C) -
D) -
E) -
A B C D E

He had been ready to give up and quit. Years later that young woman became critically ill. The local doctors were baffled . They finally sent her to the big city, where they called in specialists to study her rare disease. Dr. Howard Kelly was called in for the consultation . When he heard the name of the town she came from, a strange light filled his eyes. Immediately he rose and went down the hall of the hospital to her room. Dressed in his doctor’s gown he went into see her. He recognized her at once. He went back to the consultation room determined to do his best to save her life. From that day, he gave special attention to the complicated case. After a long struggle, the battle was won. Dr. Kelly requested the business office to pass the final bill to him for approval. He looked at it, then wrote something on the edge and the bill was sent to her room. She feared to open it, for she was sure it would take the rest of her life to pay for it all. Finally she looked, and something caught her attention on the side of the bill. She began to read the following words: “Paid in full with one glass of milk. Signed, Dr. Howard Kelly.” A) - B) - C) - D) - E) - A B C D E

Doug    : Because the performers they choose for the show are so talentless and dull.

A) I am in love with that show!
B) It’s just my cup of tea.
C) I love every minute of it.
D) Watching it is a total waste of time.
E) Watching that show makes me feel great!
A B C D E
questionText: Choose the correct option to complete the dialogue. Celine : What do you think of the performance show on Channel 6? Doug : To be honest, ...... Celine : Oh really! Why do you think so? Doug : Because the performers they choose for the show are so talentless and dull. A) I am in love with that show! B) It’s just my cup of tea. C) I love every minute of it. D) Watching it is a total waste of time. E) Watching that show makes me feel great! A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 53550

Choose the best option for the situation given below.

One of your friends feels depressed nowadays. You know that she may need help, but she doesn't share her feelings with you. So, you want to help her and say:

A) Did you watch the documentary about depression last night?
B) You should try hard to feel better; otherwise, you will get worse.
C) Why don't you go for a walk and have some fresh air?
D) Would you like to tell me what the problem is?
E) Don’t give up! You will succeed.
A B C D E
questionText: Choose the best option for the situation given below. One of your friends feels depressed nowadays. You know that she may need help, but she doesn't share her feelings with you. So, you want to help her and say: A) Did you watch the documentary about depression last night? B) You should try hard to feel better; otherwise, you will get worse. C) Why don't you go for a walk and have some fresh air? D) Would you like to tell me what the problem is? E) Don’t give up! You will succeed. A B C D E
